conclusion: Analyze the motion of the charged particle in the magnetic field and interaction with the insulating plate.
Determine the initial velocity components: vertical component v_{0y} = v_0 / sqrt{2}, horizontal component v_{0x} = v_0 / sqrt{2}.
In the magnetic field, the particle moves in a circular path due to the Lorentz force.
The radius R of the circular path is given by R = mv_0 / qB.
Vertical component of velocity remains unchanged and horizontal component reverses direction upon collision with the insulating plate.
Particle follows a semi-circular path before and after each collision.
Particle starts at point c and moves in a semi-circular path until it hits the insulating plate.
After collision, particle moves in another semi-circular path and leaves the magnetic field region at point f.
Distance between c and f is 2d, and they are on the same horizontal line.
Total horizontal distance covered in one full circle is 4R, thus 2R = d implies R = d.
Using the expression for the radius R = mv_0 / qB = d implies B = mv_0 / qd.
Magnitude of the magnetic induction B is mv_0 / qd.
